definition: to water at the mouth/to drool
to hang (down)/droop/dangle/bend down/hand down/bequeath/nearly/almost/to approach
saliva
variant of 涎[xian2]
to drool (over) (idiom)/to yearn for/to covet/to crave
to drool with desire (idiom); to envy/to hunger for
lit. dirty finger, mouth watering (idiom); fig. greedy to seize sth

sentences.english: Shall I covet my neighbour's maidservant?
sentences.chinese: 我该垂涎邻家的女佣吗？

sentences.english: US armsmakers and high-tech industries are salivating at the thought of enteringIndia's market.
sentences.chinese: 美国军火制造商和高科技产业都在垂涎印度的市场。

sentences.english: My mouth often watered at the sight of choclate in the window.
sentences.chinese: 我一看到橱窗里的巧克力就垂涎欲滴。

sentences.english: And those slots are coveted positions.
sentences.chinese: 并且那些待聘的岗位都是令人垂涎的职位。

sentences.english: Statistics like these make China's property developers drool.
sentences.chinese: 这样的数字让中国的房地产开发商垂涎。

sentences.english: His mouth watered at the sight of roast.
sentences.chinese: 他看见烤肉就垂涎三尺。

sentences.english: It’s that liberal license and the site’s mouthwatering photography that really make Nibbledish special.
sentences.chinese: 自由许可和令人垂涎的美图使得这个网站脱颖而出。

sentences.english: And he slandered him, because he coveted his kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 他诬枉亚历山大，是因为他垂涎他的国土。

sentences.english: They all but drooled over it.
I am slobbering all over you.
The Indian correspondence market in the world each big manufacturer eye, is already mouth-watering .
sentences.chinese: 印度通信市场在世界各大厂商眼里，早已令人垂涎。

sentences.english: The thou Ao eye pupil son turns around, one slavering of face facial expression.
sentences.chinese: 古傲眼珠子转来转去，一脸的垂涎表情。

sentences.english: All the guests were lured into the kitchen by the tantalizing smell of stewed beef.
sentences.chinese: 所有宾客都被令人垂涎的炖牛肉香味引诱到厨房。

sentences.english: Charming color make your lips bloom like roses.
sentences.chinese: 让人垂涎的色彩，绽放玫瑰般娇嫩唇色。

sentences.english: Now might be your chance to buy that portion of a Greek island you have been coveting.
sentences.chinese: 现在，你也有机会在希腊买到一块垂涎已久土地。

definition: to drool (over) (idiom)/to yearn for/to covet/to crave
to covet/to long for/to lust after
to covet/to envy
to covet/envious/jealous/green with envy/infuriated/furious
to covet/envious
to admire
to begin to stir (idiom)/to get restless/to become threatening
to glare like a tiger watching his prey (idiom)/to eye covetously
lit. to drool with desire (idiom)/fig. to hunger for/greedy
to envy/to admire
to be moved/to be tempted
to dip a finger (idiom); fig. to get one's finger in the pie/to get a share of the action/abbr. for 染指於鼎|染指于鼎
to get close to/to get on intimate terms with
to be fascinated/to be rapt/to long for/to dream of
to rush like ducks (idiom); the mob scrabbles madly for sth unobtainable/an unruly crowd on a wild goose chase
to yearn for sth even in one's dreams (idiom)/to long for sth day and night
